item.title: Cara add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Cara add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Cara add a quote by Derek Landy
item.description: "Doors are for people with no imagination." -- Derek Landy

item.title: Cara add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit." -- Aristotle

item.title: Cara add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Cara add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Cara add a quote by Sarah Cross
item.description: "That was like watching my dad French-kiss a raccoon-I feel violated on so many levels." -- Sarah Cross

item.title: Cara add a quote by Catherine Gilbert Murdock
item.description: "When you don't talk, there's a lot of stuff that ends up not getting said." -- Catherine Gilbert Murdock

item.title: Cara add a quote by Paul Levine
item.description: "We all hold the keys to our own jail cells." -- Paul Levine

item.title: Cara add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "If you think anyone is sane you just don't know enough about them." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Cara add a quote by Piers Anthony
item.description: "Being terrified but going ahead and doing what must be done—that's courage. The one who feels no fear is a fool, and the one who lets fear rule him is a coward." -- Piers Anthony

item.title: Cara add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Cara add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Good night, Westley. Good work. Sleep well. I'll most likely kill you in the morning." -- William Goldman

item.title: Cara add a quote by Chloe Neill
item.description: "You undo me, Merit. Wholly and completely. You don't take me at my word. You challenge me at every opportunity. And that means when I'm with you, I am less than the head of this House...and I am more than the head of this House. I am a man." He stroked my cheeks with his thumbs. "In my very, very long life, I need you more than I have ever needed anything." -- Chloe Neill

item.title: Cara add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "When I got [my] library card, that was when my life began." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Cara add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Cara add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Entertaining a notion, like entertaining a baby cousin or entertaining a pack of hyenas, is a dangerous thing to refuse to do. If you refuse to entertain a baby cousin, the baby cousin may get bored and entertain itself by wandering off and falling down a well. If you refuse to entertain a pack of hyenas, they may become restless and entertain themselves by devouring you. But if you refuse to entertain a notion - which is just a fancy way of saying that you refuse to think about a certain idea - you have to be much braver than someone who is merely facing some blood-thirsty animals, or some parents who are upset to find their little darling at the bottom of a well, because nobody knows what an idea will do when it goes off to entertain itself." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Cara add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Humor keeps us alive. Humor and food. Don't forget food. You can go a week without laughing." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Cara add a quote by Joseph Addison
item.description: "Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body." -- Joseph Addison

item.title: Cara add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Cara add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Cara add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "If you take a book with you on a journey," Mo had said when he put the first one in her box, "an odd thing happens: The book begins collecting your memories. And forever after you have only to open that book to be back where you first read it. It will all come into your mind with the very first words: the sights you saw in that place, what it smelled like, the ice cream you ate while you were reading it... yes, books are like flypaper—memories cling to the printed page better than anything else." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Cara add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: ". . . You seem upset, Charlie. Is something wrong? Charlie: No, no, I’m okay, I just had to take directions from a mute beaver in a fez to get here, it’s unsettling." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Cara add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "Well, someone slap my butt and give me a hero cookie. (Nick)" -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Cara add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Cara add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "What you're supposed to do when you don't like a thing is change it. If you can't change it, change the way you think about it. Don't complain." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Cara add a quote by Patrick Ness
item.description: "We are the choices we make." -- Patrick Ness

item.title: Cara add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Cara add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Cara add a quote by Sarah Addison Allen
item.description: "You are who you are, whether you like it or not, so why not like it?" -- Sarah Addison Allen
